name: powerplatform-vscode
description: Tooling to create Power Platform solutions & packages, manage Power Platform environments and edit Power Apps Portals
author: PowerApps-ISV-Tools

untrustedWorkspaces.description: Workspace trust is needed to configure and debug projects

virtualWorkspaces.description: PAC CLI is not supported in VS Code for the Web

disambiguation.description: This Copilot chat experience assists Power Pages developers to write code by describing their expected code behavior using natural language. They can then refine the generated code and use it when customizing their site.
examples: Write JavaScript code for form field validation to check phone field value is in the valid format.
Write web API code to query active contact records.
Write JavaScript code to highlight the row where email field is empty in table list.

powerPlatform.generatorInstalled.markdownDescription: Whether the generator installation is complete.

powerPlatform.experimental.copilotEnable.markdownDescription: Whether the Power Platform Copilot is enabled.

powerPlatform.experimental.disableActivi.markdownDescription: Disable the PowerPlatform activity bar panels

powerPlatform.experimental.enablePcfDebu.markdownDescription: Enable debugger features for PCF controls

powerPlatform.experimental.port.markdownDescription: The port on which to search for remote debuggable instances. You can leave that value as it is in most cases. The default value is `9222`.

powerPlatform.experimental.defaultUrl.markdownDescription: The URL to your PowerApps instance where the PCF control is located. This value overrides `url` set in the launch.json file.

powerPlatform.experimental.userDataDir.markdownDescription: By default, Microsoft Edge is launched with a separate user profile in a temp folder. Use this option to override the path. This setting will be ignored if `#powerapps-pcf-debugger.useDefaultUserDataProfile#` is `true`.

powerPlatform.experimental.useDefaultUse.markdownDescription: Set this property to true to use your default browser user profile for debugging. Otherwise, a temporary user profile will be created or the path specified in `#powerapps-pcf-debugger.userDataDir#` will be used.

powerPlatform.experimental.webRoot.markdownDescription: The absolute path to the webserver root. Used to resolve paths like `/app.js` to files on disk. This setting supports `${workspaceFolder}` as a placeholder. This value overrides `webRoot` set in the launch.json file.

powerPlatform.experimental.appId.markdownDescription: The model driven application id which is used to host the PCF control. Only required for full screen controls. This value overrides `appId` set in the launch.json file.

powerPlatform.experimental.browserArgs.description: Launch Microsoft Edge with specified args. (requires relaunching Visual Studio Code)

enumDescriptions: PowerPlatform PCF Debugger for VS Code will try to open the Microsoft Edge flavors in the following order: Stable, Beta, Dev and Canary
PowerPlatform PCF Debugger for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Stable version
PowerPlatform PCF Debugger for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Beta version
PowerPlatform PCF Debugger for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Dev version
PowerPlatform PCF Debugger for VS Code will use Microsoft Edge Canary version

powerPlatform.experimental.enableVersion.markdownDescription: Enable version control on file save (Web extension only)

powerPlatform.experimental.enableMultiFi.markdownDescription: Enable multiple file view in Visual Studio Code (Web extension only)

powerPlatform.experimental.enableWebCopi.markdownDescription: Enable copilot in Visual Studio Code (Web extension)

powerPlatform.experimental.enableCoPrese.markdownDescription: Enable co-presence in Visual Studio Code (Web extension only)

powerPlatform.experimental.enableTelemet.markdownDescription: Enable custom telemetry for Power Pages

body.name: Launch a PCF control in Microsoft Edge and attach debugger.

url.description: Absolute uri to launch. To enable automatic control navigation this value should be the form that the control is rendered on.

file.description: Relative path of the bundle file to debug

port.description: The port on which to search for remote debuggable instances

userDataDir.description: By default, Microsoft Edge is launched with a separate user profile in a temp folder. Use this option to override the path. You can also set to false to launch with your default user profile instead.

useDefaultUserDataProfile.description: Set this property to true to use your default browser user profile for debugging. Otherwise, a temporary user profile will be created or the path specified in 'User Data Dir' will be used.

webRoot.description: The absolute path to the webserver root. Used to resolve paths like `/app.js` to files on disk

renderFullScreen.description: Should we render the control in full screen? This only works if the control does not depend on any entity record context.

controlName.description: This value is only required if renderFullScreen is true. The logical name of your PCF control. The logical name is defined as `<publisherPrefix>_<namespace>.<controlName>`. Namespace and controlName are defined in the ControlManifest.xml. Dataverse will display the logical name of your control when looking at the control in the solution. Example: Control Name 'MyCustomControl'. Publisher Name: 'm365'. Namespace: 'Workflows'. -> Logical Name: 'm365_Workflows.MyCustomControl'

tabName.description: This value is not required if renderFullScreen is true. The name of the tab that hosts the control. If this is specified, the browser will try to navigate to the tab to load the control.

appId.description: This value is not required if renderFullScreen is true. The model driven application id which is used to host the PCF control.

enumDescriptions: Power Platform debugger will try to open the Microsoft Edge flavors in the following order: Stable, Beta, Dev and Canary
Power Platform debugger will use Microsoft Edge Stable version
Power Platform debugger will use Microsoft Edge Beta version
Power Platform debugger will use Microsoft Edge Dev version
Power Platform debugger will use Microsoft Edge Canary version

configurationSnippets.label: Power Pages: Debug Server Logic
configurationSnippets.description: Debug a Power Pages server logic file with mock SDK support

configurationSnippets.label: Power Pages: Debug Server Logic with Custom Mock Data
configurationSnippets.description: Debug server logic with custom mock data from .vscode/mock-data.json

body.name: Debug Server Logic with Custom Data

view/item/context.when: view == microsoft.powerplatform.pages.actionsHub && (viewItem == currentActiveSite || viewItem == nonCurrentActiveSite || viewItem == inactiveSite)
view == microsoft.powerplatform.pages.actionsHub && (viewItem == currentActiveSite || viewItem == otherSite) && isWindows
view == microsoft.powerplatform.pages.actionsHub && (viewItem == currentActiveSite || viewItem == otherSite) && isMac
view == microsoft.powerplatform.pages.actionsHub && (viewItem == currentActiveSite || viewItem == otherSite) && isLinux
view == microsoft.powerplatform.pages.actionsHub && (viewItem == currentActiveSite || viewItem == nonCurrentActiveSite || viewItem == inactiveSite) &&microsoft.powerplatform.pages.metadataDiffEnabled
